paper_metadata.title: Kidney involvement in hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis: a cohort study of 103 patients
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Nephrotic syndrome with normal kidney function
individual_records.evidence_sentence: One 38-year-old female carrying the V30M mutation, who had remained asymptomatic until then, presented in June 2020 with a nephrotic syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation is associated with kidney involvement in ATTRv.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common variant associated with ATTRv.
key_quotes: CKD affects almost one-third of patients with symptomatic ATTRv.
The V122I mutation was strongly associated with CKD [OR 57.2 (95% CI 6.5–7540)] and not the V30M mutation.

functional_data.summary: The V122I mutation is associated with a higher risk of CKD.

variants.segregation_data: The V122I mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The V122I mutation is particularly associated with CKD.
key_quotes: CKD-free survival was significantly lower in the symptomatic patients with the V122I mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
